definition: to look at/to watch/to observe/to behold/to advise/concept/point of view/outlook

sentences.english: Painting, writing on wall or machine and disturbing other work with concrete evidence.
sentences.chinese: 塗寫牆壁機器，有礙觀瞻，且具體事實者。

sentences.english: They result in severe cracking which is always ugly .
sentences.chinese: 這會導致構件嚴重開裂，開裂總會有礙觀瞻。

sentences.english: The Polish market in Berlin was considered unsightly and shut down.
sentences.chinese: 柏林市內的波蘭市場因爲被認爲有礙觀瞻而關閉了。

sentences.english: It's bad enough that your elbows are dry and itchy, but they look terrible too.
sentences.chinese: 手肘乾燥發癢已經夠糟糕了，更重要的還有礙觀瞻。

sentences.english: They result in severe cracking which is always ugly.
sentences.chinese: 這會導致構件嚴重開裂，開裂總會有礙觀瞻。

sentences.english: It often stinks, attracts vermin and creates eye sores.
sentences.chinese: 它發出臭味，吸引害蟲，有礙觀瞻。

sentences.english: That garbage heap is an eyesore in such a beautiful scenic spot.
sentences.chinese: 在風景如此優美的地方有堆垃圾，真是有礙觀瞻。

definition: to make sth difficult/to create obstacles
my limited view (lit. view through a thin tube)/my limited understanding/my opinion (humble)
variant of 勸誡|劝诫[quan4 jie4]
to be in overall charge/to oversee
to act in collusion (idiom); in cahoots with/villains will look after one another
